name: electricity production, photovoltaic, 3kWp slanted-roof installation, multi-Si, panel, mounted | electricity, low voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1874/documentation

Currently, this technology is not used for electricity generation in this country, APV=0. However, this technology is supposed to contribute to capacity expansion/replacement between today and 2030. This dataset represents the production of grid-connected low voltage electricity with a 3 kWp building integrated photovoltaic (PV) module. The 3 kWp module has been chosen as basic module for building integrated PV electricity production. Larger modules can easily be built with these 3 kWp modules without producing a significant error in environmental impact calculations.;An inverter is used to convert the low voltage DC power into AC power.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

From the PV module installed and ready to be used.

This activity ends with low voltage electricity produced with the 3 kWp module, assuming an average yield. 

This dataset includes tap water use for cleaning the module and itâ€™s treatment.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Current APV of this technology is zero. However, this technology is supposed to contribute to capacity expansion/replacement between today and 2030.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Electricity production with a grid-connected 3 kWp multi-Si photovoltaic panel mounted on a buildings slanted roof. See field 'extrapolation' for comment on the output voltage.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: LCI data represent specific production and manufacturing facilities (see published source).

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Amount of installation needed to produce 1 kWh * panel area per installation * water need to clean 1 m2 of panel. [unit/kWh * m2/unit * l/m2 = l/kWh]. A density of 1 kg/dm3 is assumed.

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.
Calculated value. Lifetime*capacity*annual yield = y * kWp/unit * kWh/(kWp*y) = kWh/unit and then the reciproke.
